pwa.title: Install CasaBreak
pwa.description: Install the CasaBreak app on your device for quick access and an optimal experience, even offline.
pwa.iosInstructions: To install on your iPhone or iPad:

hero.title: Discover Casablanca with CasaBreak
hero.description: CasaBreak is your urban guide to discover the best of Casablanca: tourist places, parks, attractions, street art, cinemas, shopping, restaurants, cafes and spas. Available on smartphone and tablet, quickly find an activity to do and let yourself be guided by this geolocated mobile app dedicated to outings in Casablanca.

magazine.description1: CasaBreak is an innovative mobile app designed to help you discover all the hidden treasures of Casablanca. Whether you're a resident or visitor, instantly find the best places to visit, restaurants to try, events not to miss and much more.
magazine.description1b: With an intuitive interface and precise geolocation, CasaBreak transforms your experience of the white city into a personalized and memorable adventure.
magazine.title2: All of Casablanca in your pocket
magazine.description2: The CasaBreak app gives you access to a comprehensive database of iconic places, historic monuments, neighborhoods to explore, beaches, shopping malls, and cultural activities. Each place comes with detailed information, photos, hours and reviews.
magazine.description2b: Plan your outings, create your personalized itineraries and discover Casablanca at your own pace with CasaBreak.
magazine.description3: CasaBreak revolutionizes the way you explore Casablanca. Quickly find a restaurant for dinner, a café to work, a park to relax, or a cultural event not to miss. The app adapts to your preferences and suggests the best options based on your location.
magazine.description3b: Download CasaBreak now and turn every outing into an unforgettable experience in Casablanca.

heritage.title: Memory of Casablanca
heritage.description: At the center of Casablanca, the Sacred Heart Space embodies the link between tradition and modernity. Built in the 1930s, this iconic monument bears witness to the city's rich cultural and architectural heritage. Transformed over the decades, it has managed to preserve its authenticity while reinventing itself as a space for creation and sharing. A place of memory that has become a place of life, it illustrates Casablanca's ability to make past and future dialogue.

history.title: History
history.description: Discover the fascinating history of this monument from its construction in 1930 to its transformation into a cultural center.

architecture.title: Architecture
architecture.description: Explore the architectural details, Art Deco influences and construction techniques of the era.

visits.title: Guided tours
visits.description: Join our guided tours with experts for an in-depth discovery of the heritage.

spinningCathedral.title: CasaBreak - Your Casablanca Guide
spinningCathedral.description: CasaBreak is the leading mobile app for discovering Casablanca. Find the best restaurants, cafes, attractions, events and iconic places in the white city. Available on iOS and Android.

hero.title: History
hero.description: An iconic monument of Casablanca that tells the story of the city through the 21st century
hero.photoCredit: Photo from the Flandrin Collection, private collection of the Banque Populaire Foundation

timeline.title: Historical Timeline
timeline.description: Discover the key stages that shaped the history of this iconic monument

1923.title: The beginning of a symbolic project
1923.description: The construction of the Sacred Heart Space was launched under the French protectorate, at the initiative of the Catholic community of Casablanca. It bears witness to this community's desire to assert its presence in a city in full transformation. The objective was to erect a major place of worship in the heart of a city on the rise, reflecting the rapid urban development and dynamism of the metropolis. This project thus fits into the context of Casablanca's expansion, where modernity and faith come together to give birth to an iconic monument of its time.

1930.title: The completion of an architectural masterpiece
1930.description1: The official inauguration of the Sacred Heart Space marks a major milestone in the architectural and cultural history of Casablanca. Designed by architect Paul Tournon, the building stands out for its avant-garde character, the result of a skillful marriage between Gothic art and Art Deco, a style then unprecedented in North Africa.
1930.description2: With its soaring vaults, geometric stained glass windows and clean facades, the church embodies the modernity and elegance characteristic of 1930s Casablanca. This architectural masterpiece bears witness to the aesthetic refinement of its era and the desire to make the Sacred Heart Space a strong symbol of the city, at the crossroads between religious tradition and urban innovation.

1956.title: Morocco's independence: a turning point
1956.description1: After Morocco's independence, attendance at the Sacred Heart Space gradually declined. Little by little, the building lost its initial religious function, a direct consequence of the social and demographic transformations of the city.
1956.description2: However, far from falling into oblivion, the church acquired a new status: that of a heritage and cultural symbol of Casablanca. Its remarkable architecture and its place in the heart of the city make it a place charged with history, witness to the colonial past but also to the urban and artistic evolution of modern Morocco.

1976.title: Deconsecration and change of use
1976.description1: The Sacred Heart Space is officially deconsecrated, marking the end of its religious use. This change offers it a new life as a cultural and exhibition space, open to creation and artistic dialogue.
1976.description2: From then on, the monument hosts various events such as concerts, exhibitions, screenings and numerous cultural events. This renewal transforms the building into a living and inclusive place, where heritage and modernity meet, making the Sacred Heart Space a symbol of Casablanca's cultural vitality.

1990-2000.title: Heritage recognition
1990-2000.description1: Listed among the iconic monuments of Casablanca's architectural heritage, the Sacred Heart Space occupies a special place in the city's history. With its bold reinforced concrete structure and revisited neo-Gothic style, it bears witness to the architectural genius and innovative spirit of its era.
1990-2000.description2: Its unique appearance now attracts architects, researchers and visitors from around the world, fascinated by the harmony between tradition and modernity that the building embodies. A true urban and cultural landmark, the Sacred Heart Space remains a strong symbol of Casablanca's heritage and the richness of its artistic legacy.

2010.title: Beginning of rehabilitation
2010.description1: Restoration and security work was undertaken to preserve the Sacred Heart Space, weakened by time and years of exposure to the elements. These interventions aim to safeguard the solidity of the building while respecting its original architecture, a strong symbol of Casablanca's heritage.
2010.description2: At the same time, a clear will emerges: to give new life to this historic monument by transforming it into a true center of creativity and cultural dialogue. The objective is to make it a place open to all, where arts, ideas and generations meet, thus perpetuating the living and inspiring spirit of the Sacred Heart Space.

today.label: Today
today.title: Renaissance of a heritage jewel
today.description1: The site of the Sacred Heart Space is reborn today as a true cultural, artistic and tourist center, symbol of the vitality and renewal of Casablanca. This iconic place transforms into a space of encounter between memory and modernity, where heritage, art, innovation and citizenship intersect.
today.description2: By hosting exhibitions, events and creative initiatives, the Sacred Heart Space now fits into a sustainable approach to enhancing Casablanca's heritage. It embodies the will to preserve history while reinventing it, offering the city a living, inspiring space open to the world.
today.audioTitle: Listen to the story of today

cta.title: Explore the Architecture
cta.description: Dive into the exceptional architectural details of the Sacred Heart Space. Discover how Art Deco and modernism meet in this unique masterpiece.
cta.label: Art Deco Architecture

architect.title: Paul Tournon
architect.description: The visionary architect who designed the Ex Church Sacred Heart of Casablanca, a masterpiece of Moroccan Art Deco

portrait.label: Architect of the Ex Sacred Heart Church

biography.title: Biography
biography.paragraph1: French architect born in Marseille, Paul Tournon graduated from the École des Beaux-Arts in Paris. Winner of the Second Grand Prix de Rome in 1911, he distinguished himself by his ability to unite spirituality, modernity and technique.
biography.paragraph2: Pioneer in the use of reinforced concrete for religious buildings, he marries innovation with great artistic sensitivity. His revolutionary approach transformed the sacred architecture of his time.
biography.paragraph3: In 1930, he designed the Sacred Heart of Casablanca, a masterpiece that combines neo-Gothic and art deco styles, magnified by light and Moroccan volumes. Tournon was also chief architect of Civil Buildings and National Palaces and a member of the Academy of Fine Arts.

achievements.title: Major Achievements
achievements.achievement1: Second Grand Prix de Rome in 1911
achievements.achievement2: Chief Architect of Civil Buildings and National Palaces
achievements.achievement3: Member of the Academy of Fine Arts
achievements.achievement4: Pioneer of reinforced concrete in religious architecture

philosophy.title: Architectural Philosophy
philosophy.description: Paul Tournon believed in an architecture that transcends eras, where spirituality meets technical innovation. His work embodies a harmonious dialogue between spiritual heritage and architectural modernity.
philosophy.quote: Architecture must elevate the soul while serving function

hero.title: Architecture
hero.description: A masterpiece of Moroccan Art Deco combining Gothic tradition and modernity
hero.imageAlt: Architecture of the Sacred Heart Space

artDeco.title: Between Art Deco and spiritual modernism
artDeco.description: The architecture of the Sacred Heart Space is a pioneering work of the Moroccan Art Deco movement, where spirituality and technical innovation meet. The choice of reinforced concrete, an innovative material at the time, allowed the creation of vertiginous volumes, soaring vaults, and an interior space of exceptional luminous lightness. The rhythmic openings of stained glass windows let in filtered light, transforming each ray into a colored vibration on the white walls.
artDeco.audioTitle: Listen: Between Art Deco and spiritual modernism

culturalAlliance.title: A subtle alliance between cultures
culturalAlliance.description: The building's aesthetic evokes a dialogue between European and Arab-Andalusian styles. The geometric lattices that decorate the facades recall local craftsmanship, while the two soaring bell towers echo Islamic architecture. This hybridization makes the Sacred Heart Space a unique symbol of 1930s Casablanca, a city of exchanges and cultural coexistence.
culturalAlliance.audioTitle: Listen: A subtle alliance between cultures

restoration.title: A respectful and innovative restoration
restoration.description: During the renovation, each element was treated with care: the pillars, vaults, stained glass windows and domes were cleaned, consolidated and durably protected. Particular attention was paid to acoustics, with the addition of absorbing panels to reduce reverberation while preserving the monumental volume. Contemporary interventions, sober and reversible, integrate harmoniously into the original structure, revealing the geometric power and architectural purity of the building.
restoration.audioTitle: Listen: A respectful and innovative restoration

livingSpace.title: A living and modular space
livingSpace.description: Thanks to its interior modularity, the Sacred Heart Space now adapts to new functions: exhibitions, concerts, conferences, artistic installations or performances. Its grandiose proportions and natural light offer a unique setting where heritage dialogues with contemporary creation.
livingSpace.audioTitle: Listen: A living and modular space

smartCity.title: Casablanca Smart City

hero.title: Monuments & Iconic Places
hero.description: Discover the iconic monuments that make Casablanca famous

hassan2.title: Hassan II Mosque
hassan2.description: The Hassan II Mosque is the absolute symbol of Casablanca. Built partly on the ocean, it impresses with its 210-meter minaret, the tallest in the world, and its refined architecture combining zellige, sculpted marble and cedar wood. It is one of the few religious sites in Morocco open to non-Muslim visitors, making it an essential stop. Guided tours allow you to discover the majestic prayer hall, patios and spectacular views of the Atlantic. A grandiose monument, to be experienced both day and night.

habous.title: Habous Quarter
habous.description: The Habous Quarter, also called "New Medina", is a harmonious blend of traditional Moroccan architecture and colonial urbanism. Its clean alleys, arcades and bright squares make it a pleasant place to stroll. The quarter is famous for its bookstores, leather craftsmen, traditional clothing shops and mythical Moroccan pastry shops. You can also find the Mahkama du Pacha, an architectural masterpiece. It is one of the most authentic places in Casablanca, ideal for discovering quality craftsmanship and a calm atmosphere.

medina.title: Old Medina
medina.description: The Old Medina represents the historic heart of Casablanca. Smaller and less touristy than those of other Moroccan cities, it offers a real immersion into local life: small shops, traditional markets, lively alleys and everyday scenes. You can discover the Sqala, an old fort converted into a café-restaurant, as well as period ramparts. It's a perfect place to feel the history of Casa and observe its authenticity. Ideal for a cultural walk, accompanied by a few stops in the small local shops.

artdeco.title: Art Deco City Center
artdeco.description: Casablanca has one of the most beautiful Art Deco heritages in the world. The city center, built in the 1920s–1940s, is full of geometric facades, worked balconies, wrought iron doors and historic buildings. Walking along Mohammed V Boulevard or the side streets, you discover iconic buildings: period hotels, old cinemas, banks, residential buildings. This quarter represents the elegance of old cosmopolitan Casablanca. Guided tours allow you to fully appreciate this unique heritage.

sacrecoeur.title: Sacred Heart Space
sacrecoeur.description: Built in 1930, the former Sacred Heart Church is a remarkable example of neo-Gothic architecture with an Art Deco touch. Although it is no longer a place of worship, it now hosts exhibitions, cultural events and artistic installations. Its imposing appearance, bright interior and stylized stained glass windows make it a unique place in Casablanca. Located on the edge of the Arab League Park, it is an essential cultural and architectural stop to discover the colonial past of the city.

slaoui.title: Abderrahman Slaoui Foundation Museum
slaoui.description: After the death of its patriarch, the Slaoui family wanted to share with the public the important artistic heritage that Abderrahman Slaoui had gathered during his travels or by meeting renowned Moroccan and foreign artists. Spread over 600 m2 on three floors in an intimate setting, this house-museum is charmed by the intimate atmosphere of a pure traditional Moroccan house that it recreates. The permanent collection includes paintings by great Moroccan artists such as Mohammed Ben Ali R'bati or international ones like Jacques Majorelle, orientalist posters of yesteryear and Moroccan jewelry, as well as many other curiosities that will delight art lovers. The museum also organizes temporary exhibitions, workshops and artistic residencies.

mahkama.title: Mahkama du Pacha
mahkama.description: The Mahkama du Pacha, built between 1948 and 1952 by architect Auguste Cadet, is one of the architectural jewels of Casablanca. This parliamentary building, which houses the courthouse and serves as an official reception venue, dominates its neighborhood like a castle. Its Moorish-inspired architecture is remarkable: carved cedar ceiling, finely chiseled stucco, polychrome mosaics, white marble columns and geometric patterns. The richly decorated interior offers exceptional harmony. Also called Habous Prefecture, the Mahkama du Pacha is an essential stop to admire the elegance of Casablanca's heritage and capture superb photos, even during an exterior visit.

abattoirs.title: The Old Slaughterhouses
abattoirs.description: In Casablanca, the Old Slaughterhouses have been transformed into a true cultural space, becoming a creative laboratory for the youth of the neighborhood. Located in Hay Mohammadi, a high place of Moroccan artistic and social history, the site is easily recognizable and even served by a tram stop bearing its name. Built in 1922 by architect Georges-Ernest Desmarest, the slaughterhouse represents one of the first expressions of modernity in Casablanca. Its architecture blends neo-Moorish style and avant-garde touches close to Art Deco. At the time of the Protectorate, it was at the heart of an expanding industrial zone, marked by massive rural exodus and the appearance of the first shantytowns. Today, this vast complex of buildings, courtyards and alleys extending over 5 hectares, retains a striking authenticity: old stables, traces of past activity and raw spaces. Urban art now occupies a central place. Graffiti, installations and colorful frescoes invade walls, floors and old equipment, expressing the energy of a rebellious and creative youth. The Old Slaughterhouses thus constitute a unique place where heritage, alternative culture and industrial memory meet. A surprising and essential visit.

judaisme.title: Museum of Moroccan Judaism
judaisme.description: The Museum of Moroccan Judaism, located in the Oasis neighborhood in Casablanca, is a unique place: it is the only museum dedicated to Jewish heritage in the entire Arab world. Installed in an old orphanage founded in 1948, it was transformed into a museum in 1997 to preserve the memory of the Moroccan Jewish community. Its sober architecture opens onto exhibition spaces that trace nearly two millennia of history. You can discover religious objects, Torah scrolls, synagogue furniture, traditional jewelry, costumes, as well as photographs and documents that testify to the important role of Jews in Moroccan culture and society. The museum also reconstructs living spaces, such as a jeweler's workshop or a bimah from an old synagogue, offering an authentic glimpse of daily life of yesteryear. The whole creates a peaceful and memorial atmosphere where heritage, spirituality and history meet. A true place of transmission, the Museum of Moroccan Judaism is an essential visit to understand the richness of living together that marked the history of Morocco and discover a precious part of its cultural identity.

rialto.title: Rialto Cinema
rialto.description: The Rialto Cinema, located in the heart of downtown Casablanca, is one of the oldest and most emblematic cinemas in Morocco. Inaugurated in the 1930s, it stands out for its Art Deco architecture, perfectly representative of the golden age of colonial Casablanca. With its elegant facade and large amphitheater-shaped hall, the Rialto has long hosted prestigious screenings, concerts and international shows, becoming a true cultural meeting place. Inside, the period decor has been largely preserved: red seats, rounded balconies, retro lighting and wall frescoes that plunge visitors into a warm and nostalgic atmosphere. Today, the Rialto Cinema remains a living symbol of Casablanca's artistic heritage, a space full of history where the charm of the past meets the contemporary energy of the city.

sqala.title: Bastion La Sqala
sqala.description: La Sqala, located near the port of Casablanca, is an old bastion built in the 18th century to protect the medina from attacks from the sea. With its stone ramparts, cannons turned towards the Atlantic and its traditional architecture, it testifies to the defensive role that the city once occupied. Today rehabilitated, La Sqala houses an authentic café-restaurant, surrounded by gardens, fountains and Moroccan decorative details. It is a peaceful and essential place, ideal for discovering a fragment of Casablanca's heritage while enjoying a pleasant setting by the sea.

cta.title: Discover Casablanca
cta.description: Explore these iconic monuments on a guided tour or independently

hero.title: Neighborhoods to Explore
hero.description: Discover the emblematic neighborhoods of Casablanca, each with its own identity and unique charm

maarif.title: Maarif
maarif.ideal: Ideal for: shopping, cafés, urban life
maarif.description: One of the most dynamic neighborhoods in Casablanca, perfect for strolling, shopping or enjoying city life.
maarif.features: International boutiques and Moroccan designers, shopping centers (Twin Center, local galleries), trendy cafés and modern restaurants, young, active and cosmopolitan atmosphere

gauthier.title: Gauthier
gauthier.ideal: Ideal for: gastronomy, nightlife, chic atmosphere
gauthier.description: A refined neighborhood, ideal for an evening with friends or to discover the best culinary addresses in the city.
gauthier.features: Trendy restaurants and world cuisines, bars, lounges and elegant addresses, quiet streets with modern buildings, popular brunches and coffee shops

racine.title: Racine
racine.ideal: Ideal for: premium shopping, elegant cafés, tranquility
racine.description: The right balance between elegance, discreet luxury and quality of life.
racine.features: High-end boutiques and concept stores, chic tea salons, fine restaurants and relaxed atmosphere, quiet residential avenues

aindiab.title: Ain Diab – La Corniche
aindiab.ideal: Ideal for: sea, relaxation, nightlife, sea-view restaurants
aindiab.description: The seaside neighborhood par excellence: summer atmosphere, spectacular sunsets and seaside activities.
aindiab.features: Long corniche facing the ocean, beaches, surfing, nautical schools, beach clubs, restaurants and cafés with panoramic views, clubs and nightlife venues

medina.title: The Medina
medina.ideal: Ideal for: history, local culture, authentic immersion
medina.description: To discover the original soul of Casablanca and get lost in a setting full of history.
medina.features: Traditional streets and lively alleys, souks, craft shops, small boutiques, historic sites like La Sqala, a lively and typical atmosphere

cfc.title: Casablanca Finance City (CFC)
cfc.ideal: Ideal for: modern architecture, business district, trendy cafés
cfc.description: Symbol of modern and innovative Casablanca, perfect for admiring contemporary architecture or working in an elegant setting.
cfc.features: Futuristic towers and international offices, green spaces and clean wide avenues, modern restaurants, rooftops, design coffee shops, a secure and very organized environment

cta.title: Discover the Neighborhoods
cta.description: Each neighborhood in Casablanca has its own identity. Explore them at your own pace.

hero.title: Sea & Beaches
hero.description: Discover the Casablanca coastline: beaches, beach clubs, water activities and spectacular sunsets

plageAinDiab.title: Ain Diab Beach
plageAinDiab.description: Ain Diab Beach is the most emblematic beach in Casablanca. Between long walks, lively atmosphere, seaside cafés and views of the Atlantic, it's the ideal spot to relax, walk by the water or admire a sunset. Nearby: restaurants, water activities and leisure spaces.

beachClubs.title: Beach Clubs
beachClubs.description: Beach clubs offer an elegant alternative to enjoy the sea: pools, sun loungers, terraces, music and dining. Perfect for a relaxing, festive or family day.

surfSchools.title: Surf Schools
surfSchools.description: Ain Diab is an excellent spot to learn to surf or improve. Schools offer courses for all levels, equipment included and experienced instructors. Surfing at sunset remains an unforgettable experience.
surfSchools.schools: Tahiti Surf School, Casablanca Surf Coaching, Aindiab Surf School, Casa Surf House

corniche.title: Corniche Promenade
corniche.description: The Corniche is one of the most beautiful walks in Casablanca: ocean-view restaurants, modern cafés, cycle paths, photo spaces and pedestrian zones. Perfect place to run, walk, cycle or simply enjoy the sea breeze.

parcs.title: Parks & Coastal Green Spaces
parcs.description: By the sea, several green spaces offer a calm setting to rest, picnic or enjoy a break in the shade. These areas are highly appreciated for their tranquility and proximity to the ocean.

sunsets.title: Sunsets
sunsets.description: Casablanca is renowned for its spectacular sunsets over the Atlantic. The best viewpoints: the Corniche, Ain Diab, El Hank Lighthouse or certain seaside rooftops. An essential moment to experience the unique atmosphere of the Casablanca coastline.

cta.title: Enjoy the Coastline
cta.description: Discover all the activities and relaxation spots by the sea in Casablanca

hero.title: Must-See Activities in Casablanca
hero.description: The experiences not to be missed in Casablanca

hassan2.title: Visit Hassan II Mosque
hassan2.description: Discover one of the most impressive monuments in the world: monumental prayer hall, hand-decorated, esplanade facing the Atlantic, tallest minaret in the world (210 m), guided tours available. A spectacular place, blending spirituality, architecture and panoramic views.

sacrecoeur.title: Explore the Sacred Heart Space
sacrecoeur.description: Enter a surprising monument, blending neo-Gothic style and Art Deco: cultural and artistic space, exhibitions, installations and events, a unique photogenic setting. A calm and artistic parenthesis in the heart of the city.

judaisme.title: Discover the Museum of Moroccan Judaism
judaisme.description: An exceptional museum in the Arab world: 2,000 years of Judeo-Moroccan history, religious objects, furniture, archives, reconstructions of traditional spaces. A rich and moving visit about an essential heritage of Morocco.

medina.title: Get Lost in the Old Medina
medina.description: Experience Casablanca like a local: souks, lively alleys and artisans, traditional atmosphere, proximity to La Sqala, an emblematic historic site. A dive into the Casablanca of yesteryear.

marche.title: Take a Tour of the Central Market
marche.description: A lively and gourmet place: fresh grilled fish, local products, flowers, spices, simple and authentic restaurants. To taste Casablanca and experience its daily atmosphere.

villa.title: Visit Villa des Arts
villa.description: An essential cultural space: museum of modern and contemporary art, remarkable Art Deco architecture, regular exhibitions of Moroccan and international artists. To discover the Casablanca art scene in an elegant and historic setting.

parc.title: Stroll in the Arab League Park
parc.description: A perfect space to relax: shaded alleys, lawns, fountains, playgrounds and cafés, soothing atmosphere in the heart of downtown. Ideal for walking, running, reading or enjoying a nature break.

place.title: Discover United Nations Square & Ritz Esplanade
place.description: The meeting point between the old city and modern Casablanca: contemporary architecture, emblematic places and entertainment, direct access to the tramway and major avenues. A vibrant spot, perfect for feeling the energy of the city and observing its rhythm.

hero.title: Outdoor & Sea
hero.description: Discover green spaces, parks and outdoor activities in Casablanca

zoo.title: Ain Sebaa Zoo
zoo.description: Ain Sebaa Zoo is a recently renovated zoological park located in Casablanca. Spanning 13 hectares, with 10 dedicated to animals, the zoo hosts more than 300 animals representing 45 different species, distributed across three thematic zones inspired by Africa, Asia, and America. An ideal place to discover wildlife with the family.
zoo.highlights: Family, Discovery, Education, Photos, Outdoor outing

anfa.title: Anfa Park
anfa.description: A vast modern park in the heart of Casa Anfa: large lawns for picnics, walking trails & cycle paths, sports areas & family zones, a calm and green environment. Perfect for: jogging, yoga, picnics, relaxation.

ligue.title: Arab League Park
ligue.description: The largest historic park in Casablanca: shaded alleys and renovated gardens, playgrounds & outdoor cafés, ideal park for families and sports enthusiasts. Perfect for: walking, reading, light sports.

velodrome.title: Velodrome
velodrome.description: An emblematic place to do outdoor sports: unique circular track in the city, running, cycling, roller skating, playgrounds and sports atmosphere. Perfect for: training, social activities, sports sessions.

skatepark.title: Rachidi Skatepark
skatepark.description: The favorite spot of Casablanca riders: modules for skateboarding, scooters, BMX, dynamic street atmosphere, open and accessible to all. Perfect for: sliding enthusiasts, urban photos, freestyle sessions.

cta.title: Explore the Outdoors
cta.description: Enjoy green spaces and outdoor activities in Casablanca

hero.title: Getting around Casablanca
hero.description: All means of transport to explore the city easily

tramway.title: Tramway (Casatramway)
tramway.description: Modern and efficient network for getting around Casablanca
features: 2 lines in service covering the city
Accessible for people with reduced mobility
tramway.appDescription: Free mobile app available on iOS and Android

bus.title: Bus (Casabus)
bus.description: Public bus network serving the Casablanca metropolitan area
features: Accessible for people with reduced mobility

taxis.title: Taxis
taxis.description: Two types of taxis for all your trips

vtc.title: Ride-hailing & Car Rental
vtc.description: Private transport and car rental options

carRental.name: Car rental
details: Several agencies in the city and at the airport

labels.mapDescription: View tramway and busway routes to plan your trips easily

hero.title: Airport → City Center
hero.description: All means of transport to reach the center of Casablanca from Mohammed V Airport

train.title: Train (ONCF)
train.description: The most economical and practical way to reach the city center
train.tip: Train is recommended to avoid traffic jams

shuttle.title: Airport Shuttle
shuttle.description: Direct shuttle service to the city center
details: Main stops: Casa-Port, Place Mohammed V

taxis.title: Taxis & Ride-hailing
taxis.description: Private transport for more comfort and flexibility
taxis.tip: Negotiate the price before getting into grand taxis

carRental.title: Car Rental
carRental.description: Rental agencies available at the airport
details: Several international agencies (Hertz, Avis, Europcar, etc.)
pricing: Varies according to vehicle type and duration
carRental.tip: Book in advance for better rates

tips.title: Practical tips
tips.description: Some useful information for your transfer

travelTime.title: Travel time
travelTime.content: Allow 30-60 minutes depending on the means of transport and traffic

payment.title: Payment
payment.content: Moroccan dirhams (MAD). Currency exchange available at the airport

luggage.title: Luggage
luggage.content: All means of transport accept standard luggage

destination.title: Destination
destination.content: City center: Place Mohammed V, Casa-Port, Corniche

labels.routeDescription: Use Google Maps or Waze to calculate travel time in real time according to traffic

hero.title: Practical info & cultural tips
hero.description: Everything you need to know to fully enjoy your stay in Casablanca

currency.title: Currency & Payments
items: Bank cards accepted in most shops

telecom.title: Telecommunications
items: Free WiFi in most cafés and hotels
Prepaid SIM cards available (Maroc Telecom, Orange, Inwi)

culturalTips.title: Respecting local customs
culturalTips.description: Some tips to integrate and respect Moroccan culture

respect.title: Respect & Courtesy
tips: Greeting with 'Salam alaykum' is very appreciated
Remove shoes in houses and some shops
Respect prayer times (5 times a day)

gastronomy.title: Gastronomy
tips: Mint tea is a social ritual

bargaining.title: Bargaining
tips: Normal negotiation in souks and markets
Don't hesitate to leave if the price doesn't suit

emergency.title: Emergency numbers
emergency.description: In case of emergency, dial these numbers

resources.title: Useful resources
resources.embassies: Embassies and consulates: check contact details before your departure
resources.insurance: Travel insurance recommended for medical care

hero.title: Which neighborhood to stay in?
hero.description: Complete guide to the best neighborhoods in Casablanca for your stay

transport.title: Transport
transport.description: Ease of access to public transport

centreVille.name: City Center (Place Mohammed V)
centreVille.description: The historic and economic heart of Casablanca

corniche.name: Corniche (Aïn Diab)
corniche.description: Modern seaside neighborhood along the Atlantic Ocean
corniche.transport: Taxis, ride-hailing - limited public transport access

maarif.name: Maârif
cons: Can be lively in the evening

hayHassani.name: Hay Hassani
hayHassani.bestFor: Tight budget, airport transit, long stay

oasis.name: Oasis / 2 Mars
oasis.description: Lively central neighborhood with authentic local life
oasis.bestFor: Tight budget, authentic experience, independent travelers

labels.recommendationText: For a first visit, the city center or Maârif offer the best compromise between accessibility, price and experience. For a relaxing stay, the Corniche is ideal.
